DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Human Or Animal Tissue Or Organ Transplant Or Xenograft Receive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text response that describes the human and/or animal tissue and/or organ transplant or xenotransplant received by the patient as provided by the primary history source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Human Or Animal Tissue Or Organ Transplant Or Xenograft Receive
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:The bipedal primate mammal, Homo sapiens; belonging to man or mankind; pertaining to man or to the race of man; use of man as experimental subject or unit of analysis in research._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral._A biospecimen that was obtained from tissue or organ collected for transplantation._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Cells, tissues, or organs from a donor that are transplanted into a recipient of another species._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Human Or Animal Tissue Or Organ Transplant Or Xenograft Receive
Property.preferredDefinition: The bipedal primate mammal, Homo sapiens; belonging to man or mankind; pertaining to man or to the race of man; use of man as experimental subject or unit of analysis in research.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral.:No Value Exists:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The transfer of cells, tissues, or organs from a donor into a recipient of another species.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: The bipedal primate mammal, Homo sapiens; belonging to man or mankind; pertaining to man or to the race of man; use of man as experimental subject or unit of analysis in research.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral.
A biospecimen that was obtained from tissue or organ collected for transplantation.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Cells, tissues, or organs from a donor that are transplanted into a recipient of another species.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
